intro: Leandra costaricensis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed strobilanthes, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, with a distinctive, tubular corolla. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
